meanings.definition: Convert (information or data) into a code.
meanings.sent1: I will encode this secret message so no one else can read it.
meanings.sent2: Programmers often encode sensitive information to protect it from hackers.
meanings.sent3: I tried to encode my shopping list, but now I can't remember what I needed to buy!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to encode a hidden message that only he could understand.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map was encoded with symbols that led to buried treasure.

meanings.sent1: The spy needed to encode the coordinates before sending them to headquarters.
meanings.sent2: During wartime, important messages were often encoded to prevent interception.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally encoded my phone number, and now I can't remember it!
meanings.sent4: His emotions were encoded in the lyrics of the song, revealing his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick seemed to encode a hidden meaning that left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: Represent (a message or information) in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: Artists often encode their emotions into their paintings for viewers to interpret.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization used hieroglyphics to encode their history on stone tablets.
meanings.sent3: I tried to encode my to-do list, but now I can't remember what tasks I had planned.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph seemed to encode a nostalgic memory of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The cryptic symbols seemed to encode a hidden message waiting to be deciphered.
